metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5156 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The virtnet_probe function in drivers/net/virtio_net.c in the Linux kernel before 4.2 attempts to support a FRAGLIST feature without proper memory allocation, which allows guest OS users to cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and memory corruption) via a crafted sequence of fragmented packets. It was discovered that virtio networking in the Linux kernel did not handle fragments correctly, leading to kernel memory corruption. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute code with administrative privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5156` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-66-generic - 3.13.0-66.108
linux-image-3.13.0-66-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-66.108
linux-image-3.13.0-66-lowlatency - 3.13.0-66.108
linux-image-3.13.0-66-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-66.108
linux-image-3.13.0-66-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-66.108
linux-image-3.13.0-66-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-66.108
linux-image-3.13.0-66-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-66.108
linux-image-3.13.0-66-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-66.108
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-66-generic - 3.13.0-66.108
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-51-generic - 3.16.0-51.69~14.04.1

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-66.108').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
